Finally evolving towards a workable way to manage digital content! With over 900 books in my library, I was delighted to see that when adding books to a category, the list of possibilities no longer includes books already IN that category! I would really appreciate being able to change the sort order of the possibilities between title/author/recent like you can the library itself, though. I also really wish it was possible to filter the library by multiple categories simultaneously (books categorized as "nonfiction," "reference," and "dogs," for example). It would also be hugely useful to be able to *exclude* books by category (all books categorized as "fiction" but not categorized as "romance," for example).

Updated for newest:  Well... bad to worse.  It can find Amazon to let me buy books.  No problem.  It just can't find the internet to download the same books.  Yet I can turn around and buy another book while it still can't find the net or download...   Interesting when it does download, it says it is downloading but doesn't download. Click download again and it downloads the book.  That's when it can find the Internet to actually download.  Super cluttered. It's more store than reading app.  Not very convenient for keeping track of the book you are reading.  The phrase I would use is an "Ungodly mess."   Congradulations, Amazon.  Kindle for Android went from bad [see below] to freakin' nightmare.  makes me want to rip the DRM and read them on my moon+.  OLD REVIEW from 2015: Super annoying. The app is becoming rather heavy and bloated, and it takes up a great deal of space on tiny old phones like mine. One of the last updates also created images of a number of dictionaries showing up among my books, and I would have preferred if these dictionaries were hidden in the background. But being ever-present annoyed me. Also some of the newer features, like page flipping, are very slow on my device. I have now reinstalled and older version of the app that works much better than the newer ones. It's a strange case of the old being better than the new!

Kindle is really good with an Audible book, using Whispersync. That is where its advantage, ends. I have over 100 books on Kindle, so I have to use it. Every version of Kindle, whether for PC or Android, has absolutely horrific navigation, almost no choices you can make to customize it; that is not how it started, 10 years ago. Most of the Kindle books I own I bought back when it started, & it was great. But now? Awful. Plus, you can't read a Kindle item in some other reader. So you're stuck with Kindle. If I ever find an alternative, I'll take it. I only rarely Buy Kindle books now for that reason. Since Android covers up the characters while I talk, I'm stopping this review now.
